comments.text:
As a corollary, we would have the short exact sequence when $n$ is odd:
$0\to\mathbb{Z}\to \pi_{n-1}(SO(n))\to \pi_{n-1}(SO(n+1))\to 0$

data.text:
Look at the principal $SO(n)-$bundle $SO(n)\to SO(n+1)\to S^{n}(n\geqslant1)$, and focus on this part of the long exact sequence of homotopy groups: $f:\pi_{n}(SO(n+1))\to \pi_{n}(S^{n})$. 
Identify the first set as the set of isomorphism classes of real orientable vector bundles of dimension $n+1$ over $S^{n+1}$ via $[\alpha]\mapsto \eta_{\alpha}$ and the second one as $\mathbb{Z}$ via $[\mathbb{1}_{S^{n}}]\mapsto 1$.
Show that, $f$ is given by taking Euler class, i.e. under the identification we gave as above, we can orient $S^{n+1}$ so that the following is true:
$f([\alpha])=<e(\eta_{\alpha}),[S^{n+1}]>,\quad\forall[\alpha]\in\pi_{n}(SO(n+1)).$
